ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about different genres of writing & got to read some really cool works.

I learned how to effectively write a fictional plot, poetry-writing technique, and how to write a play! I gained a lot of insight from the fiction and poetry readings. Through the workshops, I learned how to critique other people's written works, as well as how to receive and integrate feedback on my own writing.
thinking of ideas, forms of poetry, reading / analyzing works in fiction, poetry, and drama, lots of practice with writing
I learn fundamentals of writing fiction, poetry, and drama.
I learnt the skills of fiction writing, poetry, and drama writing. By the end of the course, I had an entire creative writing portfolio to call my own.

How to write short stories/flash fiction, poetry, and drama. Different styles and techniques for each drama, as well as how to engage with each one and read them. Also learned how to critique peers' work!
This course is a wonderful introduction to fiction, poetry, and drama -- great for students with little to no experience with these genres!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Super strong course!! I was a major fan.

Strengths - the readings were a great selection of pieces, the workshops were very helpful and provided a lot of insightful feedback on my writing, Emily's feedback on each assignment was very helpful, all of the writing assignments were fun and engaging. 
Weaknesses - although the guest speakers were all wonderful, I found the guest lectures less engaging than our regular class meetings.
fun readings, lively class discussion, interesting assignments with good pacing

Professor Skillings is amazing, definitely take it with her if you can!!! The whole course is well-organized but also flexible. Prof. Skillings was able to adjust the schedule when we needed more time on assignments. We were given many prompts to choose from for each assignment, which I appreciated. I also loved having the guest speakers. No weaknesses.
The course is well-structured and very enjoyable.

The course had a lot of strengths. You can develop your writing with clear feedback and consistent assignments. You read a lot of great texts in various genres. It's easy to enjoy the readings and not consider them as 'work'. It is fun and engaging! The only weakness is that there are many genres to cover in a short time so you don't go into too much depth in each one. But that's expected and communicated!
no weaknesses! The workload was super manageable, readings and assignments were always fun and interesting, the class environment was warm and welcoming, and Emily Skillings is an amazing professor.

Everything in this class was very engaging and fun for me. I would say though, we have to put all of our work together and submit a final portfolio at the end, but we never get feedback on it (even though we open up a lot about our confidential, private journey!). Having feedback in our final portfolio would be very nice:)

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It was a really great space to be in, and Professor Skillings is awesome.

YES YES YES! This has been one of my favorite classes ever. Emily was a wonderful professor and also such a kind person. The readings for this class were great- I always looked forward to doing the readings for this class. The assignments were all fun to do, if you like writing you would definitely enjoy all of the homework. The workshops were also a great way to learn about other people's writing styles and receive feedback on my own.
yes! if you are interested in writing, this was such a fun class to explore different types of creative writing.

Yes!! If you have any interest in creative writing, take it, especially with Emily Skillings. I was more worried about the drama/fiction sections since I hadn't really written much drama/fiction before, but I found it so much easier than I thought. The prompts, guest speakers, and readings for each unit made the class engaging and interesting.
I would! I had a wonderful time picking up new skills and exploring creative pursuits!
Absolutely! If you are interested in strengthening your creative writing and you have the chance to take this class, take it. No matter your major.

Absolutely! While the course itself is designed well, take it with Emily Skillings, if you can! She's a really kind and thoughtful professor who gives great feedback and fosters a friendly class environment. As someone who is usually shy and hesitant to speak in class, I found myself wanting to actively participate because the material was so exciting to discuss. I appreciated that we were given the opportunity to write in a bunch of styles and genres, and that experimentation and risk-taking were encouraged. It was also nice to leave the course with a strong portfolio of pieces from each unit that I would be excited to have my peers read.

If you want an easy writing credit, sure. It was difficult for me to engage with this course, largely due to the instruction (or lack thereof), and I would not be so quick to recommend the experience.
